div.p: Our mission, in partnership with parents and the community, is to become the best educational system in America so all students demonstrate they are caring, responsible, and knowledgeable citizens.

In accordance with the Governor's directive, all large group events arecanceled.This includes plays, musicals, concerts, PTA meetings, Kindergarten Orientation, Community Education programs, and any and all programs outside of the normal school day that occur within our schools. Follow our District News section for updates.

td.aria-label: Click to view events for April 2

tr.td:
2
Apr 2
7:30 PM to 9:00 PM
Board of Education Meeting (Virtual)
Calendar: District Calendar
Meeting Notice:
The April 2, 2020, Meeting of the Board of Education will be held online due to the Executive Order issued by Governor Whitmer, dated March 23, 2020.
The public may join this meeting at https://zoom.us/j/491420090
Link totheBoard of Education Meeting Agenda
Citizens interested in participating through public commentary are asked to email their comments toLizaSovel@wlcsd.org. Public commentary that is received, from 7:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. will be reflected in the meeting minutes.
Click here for full calendar.

div.span: The Walled Lake Consolidated School District (WLCSD) recognizes the importance of making its websites as accessible to as many users as possible. We strive to support full inclusion for visitors with disabilities and are actively working to increase the accessibility and usability of our website.
On May 7, 2019 the Walled Lake Schools community approved a $316 million Building, Infrastructure, & Equity bond. Check back here often to stay up to date as the bond projects progress.
Learn more about programs offered from Walled Lake Community Education.
Together we will continue learning and take care of Every Child, Every Day!
Youth Assistance is a non-profit organization that offers professional counseling services and conducts programs for youth and their families who live within the Walled Lake School District.

img.alt: NFHSA logo, WLCSD Athletic Logos, subscribe today watch live events on NFHSnetwork.com

div.span: NFHSA Network livestreams WLCSD HS sporting events
The NFHS Network is the official broadcast and webcast partner of Walled Lake Schools athletics.

The PTSA Council consists of representatives from each of our schools' PTA/PTSA units. We come together to advocate for all children, share our knowledge and celebrate the accomplishments of students in the Walled Lake Consolidated School District.
In 2017, the Michigan Legislature implemented the Third Grade Reading Law to ensure that students exit third-grade reading at or above grade level.

Family Access is an informational resource made available to every family. This resource provides access to real-time information about your child's grades, attendance, report cards, schedule, purchases and payment/balance information on his/her food services account

img.alt: Invisible Dad Program Logo and Text

div.span: In Walled Lake Schools, the 12 WL elementary schools have adopted the Invisible Dad program which entitles all children to a school lunch, even if a students lunch account does not have money in it.
